title: >>> The VISIONS of a WAR
body_text:
Within the past month, there has been some confusion over the scheduled dates [and days] of events. It seems only fitting to put the dodgeball schedule first:
Saturday, 03/04/06 ~ DODGEBALL 29
Sunday, 03/12/06 ~ DODGEBALL 30 (2PM Start Time at Ocean Road Park)
Saturday, 03/18/06 ~ DODGEBALL 31
Saturday, 03/25/06 ~ DODGEBALL 32
Saturday, 04/01/06 ~ DODGEBALL 33
~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~
Did the War Continue? Hell yeah it did.
DODGEBALL XXVIII will long be remembered as one of the greatest events in history. All events leave their mark on the sport, but some just happen to standout more than others. XXVIII is one of those few, elite events.
The Books:
> Attendance: 32. (Sixth highest behind XTWO, 15, 20, 13, XONE)
> Biggest Return:
Lauren Stopa (last played at DODGEBALL XTWO)
> New players: Dan Turner, Guy Ritt, Chi So, Sammy Smith, Chris Wildeman, and Todd Binger.
> Justin Pierce broke his string of events at DODGEBALL XXVIII. Since DODGEBALL DAY 2, he hadn't missed an event.
> A Brother vs. Brother feud headlined XXVIII. For Steve Adams, his previous runs as captain came at DODGEBALL X and DODGEBALL TWENTY-SIX. Chris Adams was captain at DODGEBALL 9, making it only the second time for him.
> Arguably, XXVIII was the windiest event ever. The only event most would compare to in that respect is TWENTY-TWO, also known as "Wet War III".
~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~
Most would agree that DODGEBALL XXVIII had some of the longest games ever. Only a total of six matches were played.
Chris Adams came out the winner in this one.
> Chris 4
> Steve 2
~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~
With every results page, it's difficult to pick out just a few top players. The "unknown" writer of dodgeball always tries his hardest ...
In recent weeks, John Tronolone has referred to Chris Adams as "The Undertaker of Dodgeball". The reason being when compared to The Undertaker of the WWE, the similarities are endless. Both have held "main-event status" since their beginnings. Both are highly respected and are viewed by their peers as true leaders of their respective sports. DODGEBALL XXVIII continued the legend of Chris Adams with an incredible performance. Pin-point accuracy easily made him one of the top throwers. In one game, working by himself, he eliminated a good six players before going down. His dodging allowed him to stay in games for extended periods of time. There wouldn't be a Hall of Fame without Chris Adams.
Zach Katz was a force at XXVIII. Hard throws, catches and dodges, and longevity in many of the games made him an overall top player for the evening. Since his debut at DODGEBALL XTWO, he has been a target among many.
Few people make an immediate impact the night of their debut. Names like Sara DeCuir (XONE), Matt Brown (15), and Tom Adams (8) certainly fit the bill. At DODGEBALL XXVIII, one man in particular took everyone to the extreme. Guy Ritt arguably has the most powerful and perhaps frightening throw ever. The question of "Do you play baseball" seemed to never leave anyones' mind. That very talent gained him a level of respect, and certainly fear on the dodgeball court.
The young prodigy John "H2O" Watters was a definite key player. Like Chris and Guy, his deadly weapon is his arm. He outlasted many opponents and teammates in several games as well. Without question, one of the best ever.
Admitting to being nervous before the action began, Sammy Smith played like a true pro. She had her share of eliminations, mainly by throwing.
The last piece of business concerns two of the very best in the game today. The "injured list" added both Kevin Fitzpatrick and Matt Brown this past week. Kevin endured a shoulder surgery while Matt recently broke his elbow. Both are out of action indefinitely but are certainly wished a speedy recovery.
~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~  ~
DODGEBALL 29 is right around the corner. The "action" begins later this week with the "Ultimate Poster Contest" between Justin Pierce and Dan Spengeman.
To add to the hype, the winner of the contest will not be posted here on the dodgeball website. Let's just say you'll have to be "there" to find out.
The first March 2006 event awaits. DODGEBALL 29 is Saturday, March 4th at 7PM.
